Kalah Saing sama Damri Gratis, Berapa Harga Tiket Bus ke Kertajati?
04 Nov 2019, 08:21 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Foto: Rachman Haryanto

Jakarta - Manajemen Bandara Internasional Jawa Barat (BIJB) Kertajati membantah kabar penutupan trayek shuttle bus ke Kertajati karena penumpang sepi. BIJB menyatakan bukan tutup, pengusaha bus hanya mengeluh rugi.Corporate Secretary BIJB Arief Budiman menyatakan operator bus merugi karena kalah saing dengan bus Damri yang gratis. Masyarakat menurut Arief, lebih memilih Damri dibanding bus lain yang berbayar."Kebenarannya bahwa moda di sini memang belum menguntungkan, karena layanan Damri gratis masih menjadi pilihan masyarakat," ucap Arief saat dihubungi detikcom, Senin (4/11/2019).Dari data yang dipaparkan Arief, setidaknya ada 12 operator bus yang membuka trayek ke Kertajati termasuk Damri. Selain itu ada dua perusahaan taksi juga yang memberikan jasa antar ke Kertajati, yaitu Grab dan Blue Bird.Umumnya, operator-operator bus ini masih mematok tarif menggunakan harga promo. Tarifnya mulai dari Rp 15 ribu hingga 100 ribu tergantung jauh dekat jarak tempuhnya.Mereka membuka rute ke berbagai daerah, mulai dari Cirebon, Bandung, Tasikmalaya, Indramayu, Kuningan, Jatinangor, Sumedang, Majalengka, Maja, Kadipaten, Tonjong, Cikijing, Purwakarta, dan Rajagaluh.Masih dari data yang dipaparkan Arief, trayek yang paling murah harga tiketnya adalah yang dibuka operator Arnes pada rute Kadipaten ke BIJB, dan Mekarsari yang membuka rute Majalengka-BIJB. Kedua rute tersebut hanya dipatok Rp 15 ribu per tiket.Sedangkan untuk harga tertinggi yang mencapai Rp 100 ribu dipatok untuk rute Bandung-BIJB yang dibuka oleh Bhineka Shuttle, CTU Shuttle, dan MyTrans. Selain itu rute Tasikmalaya-BIJB yang dibuka CTU Shuttle juga dipatok Rp 100 ribu.Sedangkan, untuk Damri yang memberikan tiket gratis hanya membuka rute ke Bandung, Cirebon, dan Kuningan.Simak Video "Penjelasan AP I soal Kebakaran Bus di Bandara Ngurah Rai Bali"[Gambas:Video 20detik](zlf/zlf)

Lose Competitiveness with Damri Free, What is the Price of a Bus Ticket to Kertajati?
Nov 04 2019, 08:21 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Photo: Rachman Haryanto

Jakarta - Management of the West Java International Airport (BIJB) Kertajati denied the news of the closure of the shuttle bus route to Kertajati because passengers were lonely. BIJB stated that it was not closed, bus entrepreneurs only complained about loss. Corporate Secretary of BIJB Arief Budiman stated that bus operators suffered losses because they were unable to compete with the free Damri buses. According to Arief, people prefer Damri over other paid buses. "The truth is that the mode here is indeed not yet profitable, because free Damri services are still the people's choice," Arief said when contacted by AFP on Monday (11/04/2019). Arief explained, there were at least 12 bus operators who opened the route to Kertajati including Damri. In addition there are also two taxi companies that provide services to Kertajati, namely Grab and Blue Bird. Generally, these bus operators still charge fares using promo prices. The fare starts from Rp. 15 thousand to 100,000 depending on the distance near them. They open routes to various regions, ranging from Cirebon, Bandung, Tasikmalaya, Indramayu, Kuningan, Jatinangor, Sumedang, Majalengka, Maja, Kadipaten, Tonjong, Cikijing, Purwakarta, and Rajagaluh. Still from the data presented by Arief, the cheapest ticket prices are those opened by Arnes operators on the Kadipaten route to BIJB, and Mekarsari which opens the Majalengka-BIJB route. The two routes are only pegged at Rp.15 thousand per ticket. Meanwhile, for the highest price reaching Rp. 100,000, pegged for the Bandung-BIJB route which is opened by Bhineka Shuttle, CTU Shuttle, and MyTrans. In addition, the Tasikmalaya-BIJB route which was opened by CTU Shuttle was also pegged at Rp 100 thousand. Meanwhile, Damri who gave free tickets only opened routes to Bandung, Cirebon, and Kuningan. [Gambas: 20sec video] (zlf / zlf)
